bibl.title: Despatch from Samuel S. Sevier to George L. Rives
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
Hon. G. L. Rives
Assistant Secretary of State
Washington D.C.

I am informed by the accounting offices of the Treasury, that a portion of my salary account is suspended on the ground of exhaustion of the appropriation for the payment of Consular offices, not citizens of the United States, and I now have the honor to request that you cause the Auditor to be informed that such an objection cannot properly be urged in my case, for the reason that I am now and ever have been a citizen of the United States. I have exercised the privileges of a voter in Penna. and have never
exercised like privileges or attempted to do so anywhere outside of the United States.
Requesting early and favorable action by the Department in this matter.

I have the honor to be, Sir,
Your Obedient Servant
Saml S. Sevier
Ex-Vice Consul Genl.
at Monrovia
Liberia Africa
